node.title: Australian-first study paves way for mothers returning to elite sport
node.alt: Two female Australian waterpolo players holding one of the athletes' children, smiling for a photo
node.description: Some of Australia's top female sportswomen have criticised the lack of support for new mums, prompting the Australia Institution of Sport to investigate.
node.content:
["The Australian Institute of Sport (AIS) has embarked on a landmark study, hoping to pave a path for elite sportswomen to return to competition post-pregnancy.", "The study will be the first of its kind in the country, interviewing professional female athletes about their experience both during pregnancy, and returning to work.", "Two-time Olympian Lea Yanitsas made a postpartum comeback, competing in Tokyo with Australia's women's water polo team.", "Her return has relied heavily on shared experiences with other players, who have returned to the pool, as opposed to local research which is currently non-existent.", "\"The trickiest part was probably finding the support and the strategies to work around a new baby while trying to travel, while trying to breastfeed, while going interstate, across the country,\" Yanitsas said.", "\"I leaned on them (teammates)\u00a0a lot during those early days, to try and grab some tips and tricks\u00a0that they were using to help with breastfeeding, pumping and then what to do with your milk.\"", "
Comeback to centre court
", "Queensland Firebirds' centre Kim Ravaillion admitted it had\u00a0been tough returning to the game this season after the birth of her daughter Georgie.", "", "
Queensland Firebirds centre Kim Ravaillion receiving her playing jersey after returning to the court from having her daughter Georgie.\u00a0(Supplied: Queensland Firebirds)
", "Playing netball again was not\u00a0her priority postpartum.", "\"My whole thought process just went into this little human that was growing inside of me,\" she told\u00a0ABC.", "\"It wasn't until netball was back on TV that I started to watch it again and I started to miss it.", "The\u00a0Firebirds have also been supportive of Gretel Bueta returning to the Super Netball competition, after the birth of her son Bobby.", "
Limited research on mothers returning to competition
", "Yanitsas always knew she would return to water polo in some capacity.", "She was lucky, as she is a trained women's physiotherapist, using her experience to aid her comeback to competition.", "", "
Lea Yanitsas' son, Dino, is mum's number one fan.(Supplied:\u00a0Lea\u00a0Yanitsas)
", "\"Apart from my own investigations, there wasn't a whole heap of information available for me to access on how to exactly go about that,\" she said.", "Yanitsas's teammates have become like family to her son Dino, who is now three years old.", "Fellow Stingers squad member Hannah Buckling is helping the AIS conduct the research project over the next three months.", "\"I think that there's so much room for improvement in women's sport. There is information out there, but it is limited,\" Buckling said.", "Buckling said there was\u00a0currently no consistency in the information that had\u00a0been distributed to elite athletes considering the prospect of having a baby and later returning to elite sport.", "\"It probably depends on having supportive sports doctors who can help you navigate that return to sport post-pregnancy rather than organisations having quite detailed pregnancy policies,\" she said.", "
Attitudes changing
", "Victoria Forsdick is leading the AIS 'Mum-Alete' study, which will be easily accessible for professional athletes to complete online.", "\"I do think the attitudes are changing and there are more and more female athletes that are returning to sport post-pregnancy,\" she said.", "", "
The AIS' Doctor\u00a0Victoria Forsdick is leading the study into the impacts of pregnancy in high performance sport.(ABC)
", "The questions in the survey\u00a0will centre around determining what will help or what prevent athletes from returning to elite competition.", "Even questions about family support, child care and breast feeding facilities at training centres around the country will be included.", "Dr Forsdick said: \"There's nothing like this being done in Australia before, so we want to know how our system will be able to support Australian athletes.\"", "The AIS survey is currently open to women competing at the highest level in their chosen sport who are either pregnant or have had a child in the past five\u00a0years.", "Even those who have retired can pass on their knowledge.", "Dr Forsdick hoped\u00a0it would\u00a0\"allow these female athletes to stay in their sporting career and not see it [motherhood] as mutually exclusive\".", "Yanitsas said the study was important for the future of women's sport in Australia, in helping more plan for a successful career alongside being a mum.", "\"I think it is possible, we just need to make sure that we support women in the right way and ensure the environments are welcoming,\" she said."]
